name: Jay Rosenblatt
biography:
Jay Rosenblatt has been making films since 1980.  He is a recipient of a Guggenheim Fellowship and a Rockefeller Fellowship.  Originally from New York Rosenblatt has lived in San Francisco for many years, where he has taught film and video production at various film schools in the Bay Area, including Stanford University, San Francisco State University and the College of San Mateo.  He is currently the visiting filmmaker at the San  Francisco Art Institute.  He has a Master's Degree in Psychology and - in a former life - worked as a therapist.
A selection of his films had one-week theatrical runs at the Film Forum in New York and at theatres in San Francisco, Chicago, Seattle and Boston.  Articles about his work have appeared in the New York Times, the LA Times, Filmmaker Magazine, the Village Voice and the Independent.

Taken from the PROOF exhibition 2004.
